alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 29 at 2:36PM MDT until May 29 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong southwest to west winds combined with above normal warmth, and an extremely dry and unstable airmass will lead to widespread critical to locally extreme fire weather conditions across all of northern and central New Mexico this afternoon. Overnight humidity recoveries will be poor in many areas while winds stay locally strong, allowing localized elevated to critical fire weather conditions to persist tonight and again Monday. Strong winds will return Memorial Day but not as strong as today. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM MDT Monday. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, North Central and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, Northeast Highlands, Northeast and East Central Plains from 9 AM to 10 PM MDT today and from 11 AM and 9 PM Monday morning through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to between 40 and 50 mph today and 25 to 30 mph with gusts 35 to 45 mph on Memorial Day. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity will fall to between 6 and 15 percent today and Memorial Day. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
